subs.text: September 9

Privilege operates on a sliding scale: not having to know, or seem to know, or be seen to know, not being called out for knowing, not being called in to settle accounts for what folks surely knew was being done in their name. [link]
subs.rawText: Privilege operates on a sliding scale: not having to know, or seem to know, or be seen to know, not being called out for knowing, not being called in to settle accounts for what folks surely knew was being done in their name. https://t.co/q7Yd13z3eL

subs.text: Before the war, my father's walk home from second grade took him past a little candy shop. Without permission from his parents, he started running a tab there. Eventually, the proprietor stopped by their house to collect. The less sympathetic parent answered the door.

subs.text: They like our silence, when they can get it. We should all publicize these revealing clues to how an elected official thinks about duty to citizens. For example, one recent Member of Congress here in Indiana only visited parts of the district that voted her way. [link]
subs.rawText:

subs.text: September 2

Hoosier GOP politicians support Trump-style chaos and corruption.

They adore gerrymandering, which is vote theft.

The best are gutless, the worst are corrupt. They don't deserve to be in office.

For the good of our communities, our state and nation, VOTE THEM OUT in November.

Hoosier GOP politicians support Trump-style chaos and corruption.

They adore gerrymandering, which is vote theft.

The best are gutless, the worst are corrupt. They don't deserve to be in office.

For the good of our communities, our state and nation, VOTE THEM OUT in November.
